questions.question: What is React?
options: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces

questions.question: What are props in React?
options: Properties that are required to be declared
Properties passed from parent component to child component

questions.question: What is the virtual DOM in React?
options: A virtual representation of the actual DOM
A separate DOM created for each React component

questions.question: What is state in React?
options: An internal data store (object) of a component

questions.question: What is a React component?
options: A function or class that optionally accepts inputs and returns a React element

questions.question: What is the purpose of useEffect() in React?
options: To perform side effects in function components

questions.question: What is the purpose of useState() in React?
options: To manage state in function components

questions.question: What is a higher-order component (HOC) in React?
options: A component with a higher index in the component tree
A function that takes a component and returns a new component
A component with more features than others

questions.question: What are React hooks?
options: Functions that let you use state and other React features without writing a class

questions.question: What is the purpose of the useMemo() hook in React?
options: To perform memoization of expensive calculations

questions.question: What is React Router?
options: A library for managing browser history in React applications
A library for creating CSS transitions

questions.question: What is the purpose of the useContext() hook in React?
options: To manage context in function components

questions.question: What is the purpose of the useRef() hook in React?
options: To fetch data from an external API

questions.question: What is the purpose of the useCallback() hook in React?
